posts.title: About The Trip (Pt I)
posts.text: The main comment I have gotten when I’ve told people that I am traveling all over the US to see one baseball game in each of the 30 baseball stadiums in the MLB this season is, 'Wow, you must really like baseball.' The most common question is, 'Why?'. These are both valid observations...

posts.title: About The Trip (Pt II)
posts.text: While planning this trip, I had a lot to consider. I had three weddings and two bachelor parties scattered across both the calendar and the US. I had so many different things I wanted to do on my road trip. I also had 30 stadiums to visit and 30 cities to explore. All by October 1st...

posts.title: LA Dodgers
posts.text: After driving down to SD in The Rubblebucket for a raucous bachelor party in late March, which decorum and common decency prevent me from describing in anymore detail (I might already have said too much), I headed north again to spend time in LA and to catch a Dodgers game at Chavez Ravine...

posts.title: Arizona D-Backs
posts.text: After an incredibly fun stay in LA, it was time to make the long drive through the desert to see the Arizona D-Backs in Phoenix. Whichever PR/Marketing person was in charge of officially changing the name of the team from the Diamondbacks to the D-backs, all I have to say is, Wow…

posts.title: SD Padres
posts.text: I’ll be honest, I had every intention to have a diverse, cultural experience in San Diego that would get down a few layers and show people that this town was more than a surf haven and a party centric bachelor party destination. I wanted to do a little more than just repeat the bachelor party from the weekend before...

posts.title: Seattle Mariners
posts.text: When I returned to LA, I still had a week or so until the Angels came back to town, so I took the opportunity to fly RT from LAX to Seattle, WA to catch a Mariners game in the interim...

posts.title: Anaheim Angels
posts.text: Anaheim Angels. Or… Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim? Or, the California Angels of Anaheim? …Folks, where the OC is concerned, this one is gonna be brief...

posts.title: SF Giants (Pt I)
posts.text: Oh man, where do I begin… Well, for starters, the game I attended was a special one. I took my dad for his birthday, it was a beautiful, chilly, foggy SF night, the Giants were facing their arch rivals, the hated LA Dodgers, and we won with a walk off in the bottom of the 10th...

posts.title: SF Giants (Pt II)
posts.text: And so it was with a heavy heart that I made the decision to move away from SF. The truth is that I saw a drastic change in the very fabric of the city even in my most recent 4 year stint that I lived there...

posts.title: Oakland A's
posts.text: There are just a few cities and regions in the US that boast more than one team. The split is always one AL team and one NL team. NY has the Yanks and the Mets. Chicago has the Sox and the Cubbies. The Bay Area has the Giants and the A’s...
